tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret tries to anticipate the bank robbers next move, while closing in on Honores killers.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: When nightclub singer Fairlie Arrow disappeared from her Gold Coast home in 1991, the tabloid media went to town. Arrow was reported as abducted by "an obsessed fan". Spoiler alert: it was all a hoax.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope uncovers a tragic life of secrets and lies when the body of a woman is found on the bleak Northumberland moors.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Teen Jesus and The Jean Teasers
programme.desc: Join Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers as they guest program rage for the very first time, picking their favourite clips and celebrating their new album GLORY.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Jennifer Hewett, James Massola and Jane Norman including the Liberal Party scrap net zero target, COP30, the visit by Naurus President plus the security treaty with Indonesia.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani presents a roundup of the weeks big international stories including: Police investigate deadly blasts in India and Pakistan, plus Donald Trump named in newly released Epstein emails.

programme.title: Songs Of Praise: Young Chorister Of The Year - Senior Semi-final
programme.desc: Aled Jones hosts the Senior Semi-Final of BBC Young Chorister Of The Year from The Monastery in Manchester, with judges Laura Wright, Ken Burton and Wynne Evans.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grow Peonies and Summer Veg
programme.desc: Costa joins anniversary celebrations at Kings Park and Botanic Garden, Millie visits a peony farm, Josh plants summer crops, Sophie suggests perennials for dry climates, and we meet a doctor with a tropical plant obsession.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Paula Stillie has always looked different from her white adoptive family and is on a quest to discover her identity. Meanwhile, Lisa is on a mission to find her older sister who was given up for adoption before Lisa was born.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Builder Nick is hoping to build his wife Rachel the ultimate house in the idyllic Blue Mountains; a place that for the first time in her life, she can finally call home.

programme.title: Portrait Artist Of The Year
programme.desc: Heat 3 features an array of unique talent, including the youngest and oldest artists in the competition. Celebrity sitters are Gardening Australias Costa Georgiadis, comedian Celia Pacquola and actor Talijah Blackman-Corowa.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Lost In Play And Kirbys Dream Buffet
programme.desc: This week we get lost in our review of the puzzle filled adventure Lost In Play, plus we feast on a Lets Play of Kirbys new party game Kirbys Dream Buffet!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Find out how fast your nerves work when Dr Xand blows a fuse in the lab with a new underpants experiment, and Dr Chris accidentally sticks his hand in a slimy snot sample!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: As Ladybug and Cat Noir face Glaciator again, our heroes dont know that they are about to make a chilling discovery!

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Lego, Olivia Rodrigo, Warrior Cats and Melbourne Trams
programme.desc: What do Lego, Olivia Rodrigo, Warrior Cats and Melbourne trams have in common? Theyre all topics on this episode of Hard Quiz Kids, where four young fans match wits with the hilarious Tom Gleeson!

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: While on Abbotts annual zoo field trip, Tariq reveals that he has been offered a job in New York.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.sub-title: All Dressed Up With Somewhere To Go!
programme.desc: Our heroes discover the Pokemon Dress-Up Contest, a unique event where Pokemon compete by disguising themselves as other kinds of Pokemon!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand have brought their lab into Xands kitchen! In todays episode, the doctors look at Number 2s, and show you an experiment to make your own fake poo.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week we paint the town all kinds of colours in our review of the colourful ink-splatting action in Splatoon 3, plus we fight it out in a Lets Play of the minifig brick bashing chaos in LEGO Brawls!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand gets in a spin to show you why you get dizzy, the Flying Doctors help a new baby in Australia and Dr Raph takes an icy dip when he meets a Brilliant Body who swims in the Antarctic.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Sorry to see their holders so sad to have to give up on their feelings, Tikki and Plagg make a drastic choice that will change many a thing in Paris...

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: After getting covered in soot, two hapless ducks are mistaken for a pair of rare African zebra ducks.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle hides a package for Manjaro before deciding to dispose of it to protect everyone.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: The competition heats up between Melissa and Janine as their classes go head-to-head in a read-a-thon sponsored by a local pizza shop.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: Two baby white rhinos join the herd at The Wilds; a pair of red pandas have a blind date in a tree; and a super-cute tortoise baffles its doctors.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Trigg Watson, Daniel Harel, Danny Urbanus and Jon Mobley.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Katerinas dance professor asks her to partner him in a competition piece. Mai and Ryan are planning to spend the night together. Drazic has to do community service as a school crossing guard.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Sos From The Future: A Dark New Enemy Appears!
programme.desc: Life in the present may be peaceful but trouble is stirring in the future! Trunks is risking it all to get back to the past to find help. But will he escape the new evil that threatens the future in time to get help?

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Hank asks Mavis to do him a solid and pick up a one-of-a-kind Freakerhead for him. But Mavis forgets and Hank misses out on it and now she needs a way to make it up to him.

programme.title: Mechamato
programme.desc: A brutal food review drives robo-chef Garamsey to kidnap Deep. Amato has to save Deep before he becomes the next course.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Dr. Ross becomes a local hero when TV cameras catch him working to save a frightened boy trapped in a drainage pipe which is rapidly filling with water during a torrential rainstorm. Harper helps a young hit-and-run victim.

programme.title: Live At The Apollo
programme.sub-title: Desiree Burch, Paul Mccaffrey And Jonny Pelham
programme.desc: American comedian Desiree Burch introduces special guests Paul McCaffrey and Jonny Pelham.

programme.title: Rage Ausmusic Month Special
programme.desc: rage celebrates AusMusic Month all November with the creme de la creme of new music videos from Australias best and brightest.

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.desc: A fly-on-the-wall look at the cast album recording of a 1970 Broadway musical about characters of the same co-op.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal the surprising secret behind the speed of your nerves, Dr Xand finds out what happens if you dont wash your hands.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Hope! Redux Awaken In The Present, Trunks
programme.desc: With barely enough time to stop the dark entity thats after him, Trunks travels back to the past. But when he arrives, can present Trunks handle seeing his future self?!

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Mavis stinks like rainbows and puppy dog tails. Why? Because shes got The Vapors; a next-level event in the afterlife of a vampire.

programme.title: Junior Vets
programme.desc: Its Day One at Vet School. Six ordinary school kids have been chosen from a thousand applicants. Today the raw recruits help test lonely horse Brie for a life threatening illness.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Dougs heroics earn him a second chance, but he clashes with Mark when both need to use the same equipment for their seriously injured patients. Carter and Harper renew their relationship, and Jeanie files for divorce.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam, Jamie and the build team join forces to find out could the Confederate army really have built the worlds first long range missile?

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Pam has been struggling to sell her large family home in Harrogate, North Yorkshire for a year. Secret Agent Phil Spencer steps in to explore the reasons why this house in a desirable area just wont shift.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: We begin with one of the enduring oddities of the Australian electoral system - preferential voting. Vaunted by mathematicians and theorists as a fairer way of voting. Adopted, uniquely, by Australia in 1918.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Mark becomes suspicious when his wife and daughter are in a car crash with Jennifers male co-worker. Carol tries to help a schizophrenic architect, and Lewis chooses between a career-changing opportunity or caring for Susie.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines are looking for the perfect place to have a picnic.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Mimi is making a beautiful apple pie for the picnic, but the apples keep disappearing. They look so delicious no-one can resist eating them. What will Mimi bake now without any apples?

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: At the playground, Daniel wants to swing as high as Jodi. Nana teaches Daniel that hes big enough now to try it himself!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing sees Coco with a plaster on her finger and of course he wants one too. In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but its so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family go on holiday in a special van. Peppa is surprised to find that at a push of a button the van turns into a little house for them to sleep in.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The farm is paid an unexpected visit from an escapee from the nearby prison, who takes refuge in the Barn. After a short while with Shaun and the gang, prison doesnt seem such a bad option.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: It is harvest day. The Elves and fairies enlist the help of Mr Gnome in picking blackberries. If only they could stop him from eating them all...

programme.title: Ariel
programme.sub-title: The Endless Sleepover / Daddy Daughter Dinner
programme.desc: Ariel wont sleep at a sleepover. Ariel misses dinner with her dad.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Playing Shops is the best game ever for Bluey and her friends - if they can ever get started! With Bluey questioning the rules and changing whos who, they might be here all day!

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: The spies try to stop Scarletts homework being fed to the family dog Mazey, but can Deena learn how to bond with the beloved pet?

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: When Marwyn runs out of ice, the Martians send a giant hunk of ice. The Mechas have to stop the ice from sliding into a skyscraper!

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes: Gloop The Third
programme.desc: The Power Heroes team have been glooped by Gloop the Third. Only Newton can stop him, but to do so, he has to take himself less seriously.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie + Triggs sing about all the things they love about their favourite travelling Uncle George, as they wait, and wait, and wait... for his latest letter to arrive.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: When Andy loses his voice, that days gig is thrown into jeopardy. The most unexpected person steps forward to take Andys place and causes havoc as the band race to get there.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can we make our own fossils? And fast! Paleontologist Ben shows Leah his collection of fascinating fossils and together make their very own DIY fast fossils with clay and plaster.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizards found an epic crystal and Cosima is jealous. Their squabbling peaks at the top of the volcano! Will they learn to share before its too late?

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When a sudden allergy means Fergie cant pick apples, Vida sets up a "Fergie Tree!"

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Running out of air, Barnacles struggles to free his paw from the mouth of a giant clam, while simultaneously directing his crew in a delicate Manatee rescue operation.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Lionel wants to play with Munki-gu instead of Gekko.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a pretend emergency turns into a real emergency, theres only one engine who can save the day!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and Molly go on the ultimate adventure to find the coolest bugs in the garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: On their second day in Australia, the Kangaroo family take Peppa and the family to the beach where they try surfing for the first time.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter and friends venture to Rocky Island to find the mysterious Old Rusty mentioned in Peters fathers journal.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad tells Bluey to mind her manners at the table - theyre not animals. But when Bluey gets her hands on a stick of magic asparagus, she shows them everyones got a wild side.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Duggees flowers look very sad, everyone does a rain dance to help make it rain.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: The Piris fall under the spell of a magical Merguin but all is not as it seems.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: After waking Upsy Daisy, Igglepiggle goes with her for a walk in the garden.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap is going so fast he has a big crash whilst delivering the mail and all the parcels lose their address labels. No one in Hoopla gets what they ordered so Zap needs to find a way to deliver everything again.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Prince Tuesday is packing, because hes moving away to college, and Daniel and Prince Wednesday will miss playing with him every day.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: On the way to Padgets shop Bing and Flop stop to play with Arlo the cat. Bing loves Arlo and knows just where he likes to be stroked and what games he likes playing.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George take a bin of vegetable peelings to Grandpa Pigs compost heap. Worms inside help make the peelings into compost, which Granny and Grandpa use to help their plants grow.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Never meet your heroes. The Farmers Rock n Roll idol is stranded at the farm when his limousine breaks down. Soon revealed as a spoilt pretender, Shaun decides to show him a lesson from the School of Rock.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Three baby ladybirds, Amber, Emerald and Keith have come to stay at their uncle Gastons for the day. The baby ladybirds are exhausting! So Ben and Holly help Gaston to keep them entertained.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Jewels visits and copies everything Ariel does. Sebastian tries to relax for a day.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey is running a taxi service. Her first passenger is Businessman Dad, who is in a rush to get to the airport. But with unexpected delays, Dads in danger of missing his flight!

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: When Silver Paw invades Lauchie and Scarletts new playhouse, Jeremy and Deena must save it from becoming her new evil lair.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: When the Martians break the bridge, the Mechas must find a way to help the train cross the ravine.

programme.title: The Snail And The Whale
programme.desc: A beautiful tale of an unlikely friendship, a tour of the world and a heroic rescue. Based on the picture book written by Julia Donaldson and illustrated by Axel Scheffler.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Danny needs a cake for his parents wedding. Do the band have a recipe for success?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are on the search for a new home but after all the house viewings, nothing beats their home. Peppa then suggests they extend their house instead, so the family design a bigger house together.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: The Bananaraptors fall into a deep hole and Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes must think of a clever and creative way to get them out safely.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When the Mouse Family is exhausted by Babys crying, Vida discovers that shes teething!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Humphead Parrotfish
programme.desc: The Octonauts use magnets to try to stop a meteor thats heading toward the Octopod and get assistance from a rock-chomping humphead parrotfish and her friends.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Theres a new octopus-girl in the city, who wants to be a friend of the PJ Masks. But her actions tell a different story.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas pushes Shankar into entering the Fancy Costume Contest even though Shankar doesnt want the spotlight on him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners plant a pizza shaped herb garden to create the ultimate pizzas!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her familys holiday continues. Today everyone is going to work on Mrs Kangaroos submarine!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Surprising Sisters
programme.desc: When Flopsy and Mopsy insist on accompanying Peter on one of his adventures, he discovers that there may be more to his twin sisters than he thought.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want a pet. To show them how much work theyd be in for, Dad transforms his hand into their old friend Shaun, a chaotic, undisciplined Emu with a taste for trouble.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Norrie is upset when she sees a leaf fall from the tree, because she thinks its broken.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: A slick sales rep visits and despite Pancakes doubts convinces the Piris to buy flippers.

programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: The longest government shutdown in US history is officially over, with more voters blaming Trump Republicans than Democrats for the shutdown. Chas and John discuss the fallout, plus the latest on the Epstein files.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Its the season finale of That Pacific Sports Show! Tiana Penitani Gray, Sam Wykes, Sera Naiqama and Tinirau Arona wrap up 2025 with highlights, special guests, and powerful Pasifika performances. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your weekend informed and up-to-date. Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you the latest news, interviews, politics, culture, weather and global affairs. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: Julia Baird and guest host Chas Licciardello chat about an article in the New York Times "Are women ruining the workplace?". Plus what do the resignations at the BBC tell us about the state of the media and power?

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: After years of struggles farmers in parts of NSW celebrate a successful harvest, Aurora Australis lights up night the night sky, plus the country metal band proving its a long way to the top from regional SA.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you the news from Asia: Two blasts put India and Pakistan on edge, deadly Typhoon Fung-wong hits the Philippines and Taiwan, plus we hear from pioneering Australian-born Chinese journalist Helene Chung.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Its been 50 years since the dismissal of the Whitlam government. We look back at why it happened and how its still influencing Australian politics today.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: After years of struggles farmers in parts of NSW celebrate a successful harvest, Aurora Australis lights up night the night sky, plus the country metal band proving its a long way to the top from regional SA.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Jennifer Hewett, James Massola and Jane Norman including the Liberal Party scrap net zero target, COP30, the visit by Naurus President plus the security treaty with Indonesia.
